title: (No heading)
text: Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 5:16 PM Updated at 5:17 PM Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 5:16 PM Updated at 5:17 PM Lincoln, Ill. Lincoln College sweeps Carl Sandburg The Lincoln College volleyball team defeated the visiting Carl Sandburg College Chargers in straight sets Thursday: 25-17, 25-22 and 25-15. Lincoln College was in control throughout most of the match behind a balanced offensive attack and a dominating block. The Lady Lynx front line recorded a season-high 19 blocks in the match. That gives Lincoln College a 15-10 mark. ”Our block was solid all night long, which played a big role in our ability to stop Sandburg from gaining any momentum,” Lincoln College coach Mark Tippett said. “It is very satisfying to see the work our players have put in this season pay off with a strong start-to-finish performance like the one they gave tonight.” Lincoln College stats: Kenzie Cooper 8 kills, 5 points Katie Jordan 4 kills, 6 points Cassie Jennings 11 set assists, 5 points Gina Moore 2 kills, 3 digs Lauren Wendt 3 blocks, 12 points Ashley Robinson 6 points, 10 set assists Peyton Jones 3 kills, 6 blocks Kayla Dierker 8 digs Aira Hanson 5 kills, 3 blocks Brighton Robbins 13 digs, 7 points Lockenour visits state Lincoln senior golfer Rachel Lockenour posted a round of 104 at the Red Tail Run Golf Course in Decatur Friday in the first of two rounds of the IHSA Class 1A State Tournament. She will return to the course today. Railers dominate season finale The Lincoln boys soccer team cruised to a 7-1 victory over Springfield Lanphier Thursday at home in its regular season finale. The Railers will host the Lions again 12 p.m. today at Handlin Field in the opening round of the IHSA Class 2A Sacred Heart-Griffin Regional Tournament. Lady Wolverines take care of business Both of the West Lincoln-Broadwell girls basketball teams managed wins in Mount Pulaski Thursday. The 7th grade Lady Wolverines won 46-8, led by Makayla Anderson with 17 points. Madison Orebaugh had nine points, while Tori Schilling had eight points. WLB dominated the 8th grade game 51-18. Leah Schneider posted 27 points, while Madelyn Koehler contributed 12. Illini Central loses pair of games The Illini Central Junior High girls basketball teams didn’t come up with a victory against Midwest Central Thursday. Midwest Central claimed the 7th grade contest 33-21, led by Grace Charlton with 11 points. Khloe Damm had nine points for Illini Central, followed by Gentri Fangmeier and Colleen Douglas each with four points. Midwest Central claimed the 8th grade game 32-22, led by Abby Kammeyer with 10 points. Kyndel Arthalony led Illini Central with 10 points. Lincoln Courier Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 5:16 PM Updated at 5:17 PM
